text: Arjun 45 year old male. If a thousand U.S. adults are diagnosed with this kind of tumor each year. Most cancerous brain tumors are called gliomas. These are tumors that develop in the glial cells, which help support and protect your brain and nerves. Common kinds include astrocytoma. Astrocytomas form in star-shaped glial cells called astrocytes. Number two, glioblastoma. An astrocytoma that grows quickly and is aggressive is called a glioblastoma. Number three, oligodendroglioma. These rare tumors begin in cells that create myelin or protective covering around brain nerves. Another cancerous brain tumor is known as gliduloblastoma. These grow quickly and form at the base of the skull. You commonly see these cancerous brain tumors in children.
